name: Escape the Game
description: Kevin is fed up with his game. Follow him in this atmospheric, dark and funny journey and fulfil his dreams. Is it even possible to escape?
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP, 7, Vista, 8, 8.1, 10 Processor: Intel Celeron 1800 MHz Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: GeForce 8800 or higher, AMD Radeon HD 4000 or higher, Intel HD 4000 or higher (min. 512 MB VRAM) DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 115 MB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows XP, 7, Vista, 8, 8.1, 10 Processor: Intel Core i3 Memory: 1024 MB RAM Graphics: GeForce 560 or higher, AMD Radeon HD 5800 or higher DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 115 MB available space

reviews.review_text: This game is great. The humor is spot on and even though he's just a square you actually start feeling sorry for him.
It keeps crashing for me after I enter the second portal, is anyone else having this problem?
Pretty much a demo to what I assume will be a paid product, it's deifnitely worth playing. Short, but worth the $0 I spent on it.   Look foward to the full game.
This is one of the most special game i have played. It has the forth wall breaking of deadpool. Gameplay is alright
Even though this game is short,I can't wait for the next part

Enjoyed the game thoroghly! The atmosphere is what really pulled me in though. Everything starts out lighthearted, but as things progress, the music and the lighting really drive things home. Can't wait for episode 1!  10/10 Would make Kevin mad enough to crash the game again
a fun short game for now. I still cant wait for the full game to come out.
Great game! Can't wait for the continuation!
Well, he said something about not throwing him into the lava.....naturally i did about 12 times, and well.......he crashed my game.  Best friend Ive ever had.
I'm looking forward to the main game. It was a fun little thing.
great game, simple and interesting to play, im so excited to play a full version

About 20 minutes long but intriguing, this game seems to be the start of a magical series - if the 'To Be Continued' sign is to be believed, this could turn out to be fantastic. I didn't expect much out of a free game, but this was surprisingly fun to play and well-made. A fuller version may be worth money.
A shame that it was short, but it was fun and the commentary from kevin was funny.
Nice short little experience. Can't wait for more.
fun little game, short and simple and I'm ready for part II :D
Whould have game intentionally crash again!
When you first meet the lava and he tells you not to go in it repetadly go in it about 13 times XD i love when devs do stuff like that good job XD
The game's really simple yet enjoyable. ^_^

Its a fun game and all but the intro is very confusing to me and I dont fully understand it. Once you die more than 10 times the cube threatens to crash the game and it actually crashes the game like what
THis game is really fun I give it a solid 10/10 for an intro good game great idea pls continue on
This game is amazing. I can't wait until the next part is done. I will be anxiously waiting.

Even while short, the ~20 Minute Intro of Escape The Game is extremely fun. The character you are playing with is quite entertaining with little repetitive messages and the game has high potential to be extremely frustrating. The character is highly sympathic so despite only knowing him for a few minutes you get attached to him really quickly, giving it a lot of potential to be story rich. The last level you can play in this intro kinda makes me curious if its possible to implement psychological horror aswell, since the game reflects really good how Kevin is kept in complete solitude and void, while having no one but you (and Maggie).  Please game devs, focus on the story of this game. Build in a few sick minded turns and spice it up a bit. The story could be breathtaking, the gameplay itself should be challenging too, but it will get boring if the story wont match. And keep it dark.
Will be buying full game when it comes out.

This is a cool game but I cannot tell you to get it for one reason. Its broken. It's a cool funny game and try it if you want but there are many people having crash problems and at one point in the game it said to charge your weapon and use it to boost you and I even looked up a walkthrough but the game broke on me. I was never able to do the charge and when I restarted the game it makes you restart all the way theres not even an escape menu.
Crashes over Crashes...

i was really excited to finally find something with some nice and sweet mechanic's but nope. im definetly going to recommend this game but if you only want two stages becuase the third one glitchs out then go ahead and play it

The first time i started the game up the platforms didnt even appear and then the game crashed immediatly, then the second time it worked fine then it crashed again, third time the cube gun wouldnt do the charge shot, crashed, fourth time the game didnt show platforms again, crashed. dont think im gonna comeback to this game for a while

This game is awesome, lots of good humor.  But i have a question, When the cube guy said 'Are you messing with the game files' I immediatly wanted to check out what files there where. And then i saw all the levels 1-12 and 1 extra one called level-999. I open it as a .TXT file and there was just a bunch if 0's. Was that level put there for commedic reasons? Or is it an actually playable level? Please let me know, because i really want to find out.
level 3 is broken and will not load. although so far the game has been fun and visualy apealing.

For a free game, it's got a great concept and dialogue, some cool mechanics and gameplay. The cons? It's really laggy, the dialogue takes forever to get on the screen, level changes could be a little more fluid and there definitely are a few bugs here and there. But hey, it's a free game. It gets a little lee-way, and it's still got tons of potential ^-^

The game comes off a little stupid in the beginning, but really gets fun, I mean it was addictive, I forgot the time immediately and got sucked into it, if theres ever another one released, I'm totally getting it. Not only that but the actual character you play as makes really stupid jokes which were actually pretty funny, and the game kind of had a big sick twist at the end. Enjoyed it. Would Recommend again.

I am enjoying the content of the game very much in spite of the game crashing. Within the first minute of playing I already really liked the game. I would totally recommend this game to my friends, especially if the unexpected crashing gets fixed. I would love to see more of it.

Escape The Game is a wonderful funny action packed adventure from what Ive played. However the crashing bug that seems to always occur shortly after i start making progress (beginning shortly after the 2nd or 3rd level makes it somewhat unplayable seeing as how there is no saving system you would have to replay all the levels over and over just to reach the new ones. Will continue playing and write full length review of the game if crashing bug is fixed but all in all a really great game with lots of potential!
Awesome game 'intro', i'm very curious about the full game :)
after the robot level it just freezes and i cant play it any help

Awesome art style, good music, funny dialogue, surprisingly responsive movement. Though relatively basic, the limited bit of combat in the intro actually feels smooth and satisfying, particularly becuse of the added layer the grappling adds to it. So yeah, fantastic game so far, and I'm really looking forward to playing the rest of it. Also, the fact that Kevin's promises to crash the game weren't idle threats was hilarious.

I really enjoyed the game. Waiting on the sequel.

Well apparently Kevin is holding a grudge. I was able to get in to the game, get to know Kevin, help him out a bit, but then he brought me to a very tricky path...he even stated it was tricky so he should have had a little more understanding. I ended up killing him multiple times, and at first, he was patient, but then he wanted to start getting lippy and making threats to pull the plug on the game. He said if I killed him one more time, that was it...but did he offer any guidance how to get him through that tricky part? No.   So I killed him.  And he rage quit.  He rage quit so hard, I can't even try to start the game again...it crashes every single time on start up now.  Kevin's a bit of a pansy. I guess he'll be stuck in the game forever.   Kevin, if you see this: Help me help you.

Escape the Game is a simple, mildly entertaining 2D platformer. There’s a lot to like, but also a lot that could be improved to make it even better. The overall design and music are quite nice (more funk, please!) and the premise is interesting enough. The writing could be tweaked a bit, since some of the dialogue seemed a bit forced, and it would be cool to further develop Kevin’s character (for example, why does Kevin want to escape the game so badly?). Given that this is only the introduction, though, I’m looking forward to what the developer has in store.
It doesnt work for me after the first part!!!
